>>expected result, but Integer doesn't) my guess is that for some reason
>>your variables are being promoted to integer values durring addition


 From "A Java Programmer's guide to Java Certification", p 512:

Unary numeric promotion is applied to the single operand of unary 
arithmetic operators - and +. In other words, when a unary operator is 
applied to an operand of byte, short or char type, the operand is first 
promoted to a value of type int, with the evaluation resulting in an int 
value.  Assigning the int result to a variable of these types requires 
an explicit narrowing conversion [...]:

    byte b = 3;    // int literal in range. Implicit narrowing.
    b = (byte) -b; // explicit narrowing on assignment required.
